intro: Rubus glaucellus microgene praetextus, commonly known as the pale-haired blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and aggregate fruits, which are typically dark purple to black in color. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by the development of its edible berries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland areas or along the edges of forests. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species within its native range.
